safecaR_complaints

safecaR_complaints.Rmd

Introduction

The safecaR package provides a tidy interface to NHTSA APIs, including crash ratings, recalls, and complaints.

This article focuses on the complaints API, which provides access to vehicle recall information reported to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA).

Using the recalls interface, you can:

  • List available model years, makes, and models

  • Retrieve detailed complaint records for individual vehicles

All functions return tibbles, making them easy to use in data analysis pipelines.

Listing Model Years 

# List available years in the NHTSA repository
years <- list_complaint_years()
head(years)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 1
#>   modelYear
#>   <chr>    
#> 1 1949     
#> 2 1955     
#> 3 1957     
#> 4 1958     
#> 5 1959     
#> 6 1960

Listing Makes for a Year 

# List makes for 2022
makes <- list_complaint_makes(2022)
head(makes)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 2
#>   modelYear make           
#>   <chr>     <chr>          
#> 1 2022      ACURA          
#> 2 2022      AIRSTREAM      
#> 3 2022      ALFA ROMEO     
#> 4 2022      ALLIANCE RV    
#> 5 2022      AMERICAN HAULER
#> 6 2022      APRILIA

Listing Models for a Make and Year 

# List models for Acura in 2022
models <- list_complaint_models(2022, "Acura")
head(models)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 3
#>   modelYear make  model
#>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>
#> 1 2022      ACURA RDX  
#> 2 2022      ACURA RDX  
#> 3 2022      ACURA MDX  
#> 4 2022      ACURA MDX  
#> 5 2022      ACURA ILX  
#> 6 2022      ACURA TLX

Retrieving Recalls 


recalls <- get_complaints(2022, "ACURA", "RDX")
head(recalls)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 16
#>   odiNumber manufacturer             crash fire  numberOfInjuries numberOfDeaths
#>       <int> <chr>                    <lgl> <lgl>            <int>          <int>
#> 1  11684165 Honda (American Honda M… TRUE  FALSE                0              0
#> 2  11656728 Honda (American Honda M… TRUE  FALSE                0              0
#> 3  11637502 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0
#> 4  11637044 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0
#> 5  11635411 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0
#> 6  11634972 Honda (American Honda M… FALSE FALSE                0              0
#> # ℹ 10 more variables: dateOfIncident <chr>, dateComplaintFiled <chr>,
#> #   vin <chr>, components <chr>, summary <chr>, products_type <chr>,
#> #   products_productYear <chr>, products_productMake <chr>,
#> #   products_productModel <chr>, products_manufacturer <chr>

Retriving Recalls by ODI Number 

complaints <- get_complaints_by_odi_number("11684165")
head(complaints)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 16
#>   odiNumber manufacturer             crash fire  numberOfInjuries numberOfDeaths
#>       <int> <chr>                    <lgl> <lgl>            <int>          <int>
#> 1  11684165 Honda (American Honda M… TRUE  FALSE                0              0
#> # ℹ 10 more variables: dateOfIncident <chr>, dateComplaintFiled <chr>,
#> #   vin <chr>, components <chr>, summary <chr>, products_type <chr>,
#> #   products_productYear <chr>, products_productMake <chr>,
#> #   products_productModel <chr>, products_manufacturer <chr>

Notes

  • Function inputs are case-insensitive. For example, “ACURA”, “Acura”, and “acura” are all valid.

  • All outputs are tidy tibbles for easy integration with dplyr or ggplot2.
